content.head: Mumbling.sh
content.body:
#!/bin/bash
accum () {
    
    final=''
    # We can accomplish selecting each letter with a for loop.
    # The range of the loop is from 0 to the Length of the input ($1)
    for((i=0; i<${#1}; i++))
    do
        # This will slice each letter of our input string, one at a time
        letter=${1:${i}:1}

        # Once we have the letter, 
        # pad it with the appropriate number of spaces
        letterSpaced=$(printf "%$((i+1))s" "$letter")

        # The spaces we just added for padding,
        # replace those with the character we are currently on
        letterCoppied=${letterSpaced// /$letter}

        # Lowercase the whole string
        letterCoppied=${letterCoppied,,}

        # Uppercase the first letter, and add a '-'
        final+="${letterCoppied^}-"
    done
    # Because we added a '-' to ever section,
    # we will have an extra '-' on the end,
    # slice it off
    echo ${final:0:-1}
}

# Be sure to call your function with the appropriate input!
accum "$1"

content.head: DisemvowelTrolls.sh
content.body:
#! /usr/local/bin/bash

# The secret to this is knowing about sed
# sed is "Stream Editor"
# The most common thing we do with sed, is substitute letters
# 's/ mean to substitue
# Since we don't want vowels we use [aeiouAEIOU] as the letters to look for.
# the []s mean a OR e OR i OR ...
# When we find a match, it is replaced the with, in this case, nothing.
# /g means to do this for every match we find.
echo $1 | sed 's/[aeiouAEIOU]//g'

# Yay - it passes!
